dt: {bc}to yield or grant typically by treaty

dt.t: Russia {it}ceded{/it} Alaska to the U.S. in 1867.
{it}ceded{/it} his stock holdings to his children

et: borrowed from French or Latin; French {it}céder{/it}, borrowed from Latin {it}cēdere{/it} "to go, move away, withdraw, yield," perhaps, if derived from an originally transitive meaning "drive away," akin to Sanskrit {it}sedhati{/it} "(she/he) chases away," Avestan {it}siiazdat{/it} "will chase away"
shortdef: to yield or grant typically by treaty
